channel.title: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics
channel.description: These are the errors and there edit files please help me!

item.title: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:8, topic:545797”]You have to tell the JAVA compiler where the .java files are that you want to compile.

Compiling is basically turning the code into computer readable 1s and 0s, or binary. The only way you can run a JAVA program is by compiling it because the computer cant read the code by itself![/quote]

Okay thanks, I don’t know truly if i’ll understand but lol i’ll make the best from it.

Read full topic
item.source: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics

item.title: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

You have to tell the JAVA compiler where the .java files are that you want to compile.

Compiling is basically turning the code into computer readable 1s and 0s, or binary. The only way you can run a JAVA program is by compiling it because the computer cant read the code by itself!

Read full topic
item.source: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics

item.title: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:545797”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=664681.msg4443713#msg4443713 date=1407792144]

You need to point the compiler to your source files. You’re trying to compile when there are no files present in the current directory.

That would be the second problem. The first is that he doesn’t have 1.5G of RAM to allocate to Java.

So, I don’t have enough ram to run…? okay well I believe I fixed the last problem and ran into a new one that keeps telling me this “The System Cannot Find The Path Specified” how can I fix this?
[/quote]

The -Xmx1500m basically stats to reserve 1.5GB of RAM Max for the JVM. If you have 4 GB of Ram and 3.6 are currently being used, you won’t have enough.

As for the “The system cannot find the path specified” error, that just means that the directory you put into the command line (C:\Program File (x86)\Java\jdk**\bin\blah.exe" was not found. Go to that exact directory and verify everything is correct.[/quote]

Go to the exact file where? in my client? Or just search through C:/program files ect… to make sure its all correct which I would see no reason it would not be as I went through the copied from the top and pasted into the run notepad

Read full topic
item.source: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics

item.title: Errrors on my client someone please help ASAP i have pics
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:5, topic:545797”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=664681.msg4443600#msg4443600 date=1407735483]

You need to point the compiler to your source files. You’re trying to compile when there are no files present in the current directory.

That would be the second problem. The first is that he doesn’t have 1.5G of RAM to allocate to Java.
[/quote]

So, I don’t have enough ram to run…? okay well I believe I fixed the last problem and ran into a new one that keeps telling me this “The System Cannot Find The Path Specified” how can I fix this?[/quote]

The -Xmx1500m basically stats to reserve 1.5GB of RAM Max for the JVM. If you have 4 GB of Ram and 3.6 are currently being used, you won’t have enough.

As for the “The system cannot find the path specified” error, that just means that the directory you put into the command line (C:\Program File (x86)\Java\jdk**\bin\blah.exe" was not found. Go to that exact directory and verify everything is correct.

Read full topic

So, I don’t have enough ram to run…? okay well I believe I fixed the last problem and ran into a new one that keeps telling me this “The System Cannot Find The Path Specified” how can I fix this?
